arts.ttl: Goalkeeper conundrum, Torp's time to shine and there's only one Mark Robins - Andy Turner
arts.sum: After getting off to a really bright start and getting their noses in front via the boot of Haji Wright, who started and finished a swift counter attack from a defended corner, the Sky Blues were left to reflect on a poorly defended QPR equaliser when their goalkeeper should have done better, and bad decision making at the other end where substitute Ellis Simms had two opportunities to put the game beyond the hosts. The first saw him played through on goal by Haji Wright and attempt to slot the ball past goalkeeper Paul Nardi, who raced out to narrow the angle and make the save when Simms appeared to have time to take a touch round him and score in an empty net.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins makes Coventry City admission but remains steadfast in his belief
arts.sum: The Sky Blues gave up a goal lead at fellow strugglers QPR on Tuesday night and had to settle for a point – the latest in a sequence of results that has seen them win just one in their last nine Championship games, and result in them dropping into the bottom three. Mark Robins admits that nobody at Coventry City feels “comfortable” at the minute but firmly believes his players will rediscover their confidence to start winning football matches.

arts.ttl: ‘We cannot throw our work in the bin’ - Marti Cifuentes claims there is more to come from QPR after they end losing streak against Coventry
arts.sum: We know we need to improve in many areas of our game, but I do see players that want to play for this team. The fans at the end were really appreciating the effort that the guys did today despite not being able to win the game and this is the kind of atmosphere that we want to build.
How we rated the players. The post QPR v Coventry player ratings appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: ‘Encouraging signs’ – Cifuentes backs QPR’s summer signings after draw with Coventry
arts.sum: Rangers reaction. The post ‘Encouraging signs’ – Cifuentes backs QPR’s summer signings after draw with Coventry appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins points to two key moments as Coventry City drop into bottom three
arts.sum: “I think it was a game where here were two teams lacking a bit of belief and confidence,” said the City manager, speaking after the 1-1 draw in West London that resulted in the Sky Blues dropping into the bottom three. And then late on in the match Ellis Simms went for goal and was denied by a save when Norman Bassette was clean through in space to his right.

arts.ttl: The lowdown on QPR 1-1 Coventry - Rangers move off the bottom of the league but winless run continues
arts.sum: Coventry had the better opportunities to snatch the win but QPR goalkeeper Paul Nardi twice did well to deny Ellis Simms when the striker was through on goal. Rangers started the game brightly, with a big tackle by Jonathan Varane followed by Kader Dembele winning a corner.

arts.ttl: Kieran Morgan scores first career goal to earn a point for QPR against Coventry
arts.sum: The 18-year-old midfielder, making only his second substitute appearance for Rangers, struck in the second half to level after Haji Wright’s opener.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings as Haji Wright opener cancelled out in hard-fought draw at QPR - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Haji Wright started and finished the move for the opening goal when he raced upfield on the counter attack and then got himself in the box to steer home after Brandon Thomas-Asante had played the ball into the area to give City a fourth minute lead. Although Coventry looked more of an attacking threat in the second half, Rangers got a deserved equaliser when Paul Smyth get the better of Jay Dasilva down the right to hit a cross to the D where substitute Kieran Morgan hit a first time shot that bounced to beat Oliver Dovin in the centre of his goal with 63 minutes on the clock.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins makes two changes to his Coventry City team to face QPR at Loftus Road
arts.sum: City: Oliver Dovin; Joel Latibeaudiere, Bobby Thomas, Luis Binks, Milan van Ewijk: Josh Eccles, Ben Sheaf; Jay Dasilva, Jack Rudoni; Brandon Thomas-Asante, Haji Wright. Jack Rudoni completes the midfield three, while the two changes come up top where Haji Wright and Brandon Thomas-Asante come in as a straight replacement for Ellis Simms and Norman Bassette.
